metadata.title: Ahoy there, little polar bear
metadata.description: When a young polar bear is caught in a fishing net which brings him to the city, the friendly ship's cat helps him return home

metadata.title: The silver cart
metadata.description: Two boys load a grocery cart with provisions, leave city life behind, and spend a night at Bear Mountain. Illustrated with black and white photographs

metadata.title: In the land of the great snow-bear : a tale of love and heroism
What the grizzly knows
metadata.description:
1 v. (unpaged) : 30 cm

When night falls magical things begin to happen to Teddy, taking the reader on an adventure around the countryside and seeing the world through the senses of a bear

metadata.title: Bear in the air
metadata.description:
[32] p. : 25 cm

A teddy bear begins an adventurous journey home after being lost by the child who loves him

When a teddy bear is lost by the child who loves him, the bear begins an adventurous journey to get home again

3.0

K-3

Accelerated Reader LG 2.9 0.5

metadata.title: Smugglers on Grizzly Mountain
metadata.description:
128 pages : 19 cm

Twelve-year-old Eric and his fellow wildlife conservation agents must face harsh Alaskan weather, grizzly bears, and mushroom smugglers

"For ages 8-12"--Page 4 of cover

metadata.title: It's raining, Yancy & Bear
metadata.description: Yancy and his Bear are looking forward to spending a special day helping Grandfather plant his garden, but when it begins to rain, they have to change their plans and set out on an entirely different adventure

metadata.title: The three grasshoppers
metadata.description: Three grasshopper friends learn the value of friendship and co-operation

metadata.title: Surviving Bear Island
metadata.description:
186 pages : 24 cm

This thrilling adventure begins after a sea kayaking trip takes a dangerous turn and Tom Parker is stranded on the remote, outer coast of the unpopulated Bear Island in the rough terrains of the Alaskan wilderness. With only a small survival kit in his pocket, Tom finds himself soaked and freezing, and worst of all alone. Desperate to find his father, Tom doesn't know how long he can survive and he must put his skills to the test as he fights to reach safety. Will Tom make it through a wilderness full of bears and other dangers?

metadata.title: The Berenstain Bears in the wax museum
metadata.description:
101 p. : 20 cm

Brother Bear and his friend Fred get more excitement than they had hoped for when they become involved in the efforts to build an entertainment complex including a wax museum in Beartown

metadata.title: Gold diggers : the secret of Bear Mountain
Dozer's run : a true story of a dog and his race
metadata.description:
1 volume (unpaged) : 24 x 29 cm

In May 2011, unbeknownst to his owner, Dozer slipped out of his yard in Highland, Maryland, enticed by the sight of people running past. The runners were participating in the Maryland Half Marathon, a race benefiting the University of Maryland Greenebaum Cancer Center. Dozer joined the two thousand runners in the race, inspiring everyone along the thirteen-mile race course

Age 6-8

Accelerated Reader blank 2.8

metadata.title: New Amsterdam
metadata.description: In a world where the sun never set on the British Empire, where Holland finally ceded New Amsterdam to the English only during the Napoleonic wars, and where the expansion of the American colonies was halted by the war magic of the Iroquois, they are exiles in the new world--and its only hope for justice

metadata.title: Three stories you can read to your teddy bear
Mr. Beans
metadata.description:
160 pages ; 22 cm

A Native American boy rescues a performing bear in this story of high adventure. In a small town in Oregon in the early 1940s, bully Mugsy wrongfully accuses a tame bear of attacking him, & timid Chirp frees the bear & takes off with him on a wilderness journey

metadata.title: Muppet Treasure Island : the movie storybook
metadata.description:
1 volume (unpaged) : 26 cm

Young Jim Hawkins and his pals Rizzo and Gonzo sail the high seas in search of hidden treasure, with a dashing green sea captain, a half-wit bear, and crew of cutthroat pirates

Nine full-color trading cards attached inside back cover

metadata.title: The Kid Who Climbed Everest : the Incredible story of a 23-year-old's summit of Mt. Everest
metadata.description: Originally published as: Facing up. London : Macmillan, 2000

metadata.title: The bridge in the clouds
metadata.description:
"An Archway paperback."

Originally published: Great Britain : Bodley Head Children's Books, 1992

Uncle Jack and Phoebe are nervous, Morden's rats abound, Jasper the owl warns of danger and, as the last battle looms closer, William, Mary, and Alice must risk their lives to find the Magician and keep Morden from becoming all-powerful

metadata.title: Miki and the wishing star
metadata.description:
1 volume (unpaged) : 29 cm

Miki is back in this wintery tale of determination, friendship and hope. It's the three friends' birthday and they all make a special wish, but Penguin's wish leads him into dangerous territory...A magical Antarctic journey in a book. Miki is a highly successful character in the gift and greeting card market and a theatre production is currently touring the country to rave reviews. A firm favourite with CBeebies, Miki was read on CBeebies Bedtime Hour by David Tennant and Miki and the Moon Blossom by Patrick Stewart

metadata.title: Bunk 3, Teddy and me
metadata.description:
"A Parachute Press book."

"A Minstrel book."

2.2

6-10

Michelle is off to sleep-over camp. And she's sure she's going to have the best summer ever! Wrong! by the second day, she hates camp! A big bully named Brenda won't leave Michelle alone. Brenda kicks Michelle out of her bunk. She sneaks salt into her cereal She even steals Michelle's teddy bear! Michelle is furious. She wants to get even! Does Michelle have what it takes to put Brenda in her place?

metadata.title: The big adventure of the Smalls
metadata.description:
[32] p. : 31 cm

When everyone in the Small family is getting ready for the Small Hall Ball except Paul and Sally Small, who are too young to join in the fun, Paul's teddy bear falls over the banister into the festivities, and Paul and Sally must rescue him!

The Small children won't let anything large stand in the way of finding their missing friend

metadata.title: The shark-headed bear thing
metadata.description:
pages cm

Benjamin Blank is in search of adventure. So when a shark-headed bear-thing starts terrorising a nearby village, Ben grabs his magic gauntlet and sets off to vanquish the beast! Bun the course of true adventure does not run smoothly. Ben will need all his cunning to save the day, and it'd be good if he knew how to work his gauntlet too

7+
